## zip() function

Combine the elements of two given arrays into a single array of pairs. If the input arrays are not the same length, excess elements will be ignored.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
declare function zip<T, U>(inputArr1: T[], inputArr2: U[]): [T, U][];
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  inputArr1 | T\[\] | first array |
|  inputArr2 | U\[\] | second array |

<b>Returns:</b>

\[T, U\]\[\]

array of tuples, each tuple containing an element of first and second array

## Example 1

Here's a simple example:

```
// evaluates to [[10, "a"], [20, "b"], [30, "c"]]:
zip([10, 20, 30], ["a", "b", "c"])
```

## Example 2

Here's an example where excess elements on one side are ignored:

```
// evaluates to [[10, "a"], [20, "b"], [30, "c"]]:
zip([10, 20, 30, 40, 50], ["a", "b", "c"])
```
